text: Happy crypto easter to those who celebrate

GM Farcaster has two special events for our @hypsersub coming up for FarCon. On Wednesday April 30 at 5 pm ET we have our karaoke happy hour and on Friday we have a breakfast meetup at 8 am ET with early entry into the FarCon Summit, special swag bag and a sneak peek at our media studio! RSVP below!

cast.text:
Attention GM Farcaster hypersub: If you're coming to FarCon, Join NounishProf and @adrienne for a welcome to FarCon happy hour with appetizers & karaoke in Williamsburg! This event is for our GM Farcaster Hypersub holders (wowow and mole tiers) and invited guests. Singing optional; fun required!

Please request to join if you'll be in NYC on April 30 -- we'd love to see you! Priority approvals for our active GM Farcaster Hypersub. (note: we've momentarily paused new signups to allow for current active members to have first opportunity to rsvp - we are revamping our hypersub and will reopen next week.)

text:
29 Seconds of Farcaster ... what did you miss this weekend?

* @afrochicks gave us a killer cast reminding us that "bringing the world onchain means bringing the world onchain" & how westerners need to understand & empathize with others (esp. Africa) perception of coming on FC

* @tayyab announced Octant's biggest FC Retro Funding round yet at up to 15 ETH

* @v shared that FC signups are headed to basically free--snapchain allows initiating steps to get there

* The 'tips for casts' discussion evolved & heated up w/ notable FCers discussing the need for a cast response that tips ~ $0.25

* @dwr.eth teased a new feature for the sidebar; & $bracky brought renewed interest to the NBA Playoffs in a new format

* 'This week in mini apps' hosted by @linda & @horsefacts.eth gave us a great rundown by @phil of the QR mini app by @jake which shows the convergence of many FC building blocks

* Join @adrienne & @nounishprof after a week off, sure to far exceed 29 Minutes üòÇ to catch up & start the week 8:30 AM EST

cast.text: GM Farcaster is back this week starting tomorrow at 8:30 am ET with @adrienne and prof getting caught up on the happenings of last week. Then Wednesday join us at 11:30 am ET with special guest @vpabundance.eth from @octant and Friday @esteez.eth is popping by to chat about /farcon-nyc. Get ready for a great week ahead!

text:
Introducing Trending Topics

Algorithmic collections of casts about topics people are talking about. They update a few times per day.

Mobile only to start. Update to the latest version of Warpcast from the your app store and restart your app 1-2x. 

Topics will appear on the search tab and in your feed while you're scrolling. 

We‚Äôre running this as an experiment in Warpcast for the next couple months.

---

> Are these channels?

Trending topics **are not** channels. They are collections casts about a popular topic identified by an AI-powered algorithm. Channels have no bearing on trending topics.

> Are the topics on the protocol?

The casts themselves are on the protocol but the categorization and feeds are generated by Warpcast. There are developer tools like @mbd that can provide this for your app.

The web Developer Tools just got a new fresh coat of paint!

The tools are focused on validating, previewing and publishing your mini apps.

We removed building the json builder since starter projects and other tools can help with that (more to come).
We also removed localhost support because it didn't work well and it was a source of frustration for devs, we recommend using a tunnel instead.

One more thing...

We now provide you with analytics for your Mini Apps on the web Developer Tools!

We call them... charts.

Starting with: 
- Unique Users
- Opens
- Transactions
- Unique Users with a Transaction

Mini app builders: I often get asked how to make sure your mini app works well in Coinbase Wallet.

One of the biggest issues: mini apps that use Warpcast deeplinks (many even buttons that say ‚ÄúShare to Warpcast‚Äù) where users are dropped into a dead-end logged out Warpcast screen in the browser.

To ensure full compatibility across clients, switch from Warpcast cast intent URLs to using composeCast from the Farcaster Mini Apps SDK.

Snapchain is now live! 

Warpcast and Neynar are reading and writing from Snapchain. Casting across apps is now faster, more reliable and more likely to scale as Farcaster grows. 

I recorded a new beginner friendly video series to explain how this works: 

https://youtu.be/xVqcy2hqUVs?si=ufnFHiALYDGeylx0

text:
Warpcast Wallet makes gas problems go away. 

If you need ETH on base but only have USDC, the wallet will prompt you to swap it as part of your transaction. Users don't have to think about gas, and it just works.

cast.text:
New feature: Gasless mini app interactions ‚ú®

Warplet now enables mini-app transactions even without sufficient ETH

For developers: charge in ETH knowing the app will automatically swap for it if needed. Plus, users low on gas will get a $1 auto-swap to complete transactions

Demo #1 - minting topi from @azflin with my USDC

text:
New feature: Gasless mini app interactions ‚ú®

Warplet now enables mini-app transactions even without sufficient ETH

For developers: charge in ETH knowing the app will automatically swap for it if needed. Plus, users low on gas will get a $1 auto-swap to complete transactions

Demo #1 - minting topi from @azflin with my USDC

New FIP: Storage Redenomination 

The goal is to get to effectively "free signups" by reducing fees to 5c over time. At this price, apps will be able to sponsor users who pass sybil checks.  

https://github.com/farcasterxyz/protocol/discussions/229

Side events keep on rolling!!
üìç Morning Run with @carlos, @w3runn3rs
üìç Mini App Spotlight with @seedclub 
üìç Builders Happy Hour with @janehk, Volt Capital

Reminder that tomorrow is the last day to sign up for the FarCon Open!! üëÄ 

All other details are on farcon.nyc of course ü§©

AMPS FOR ALL

1) Starting tomorrow, anyone can buy recasts from their followers via @ampsfun 

2) If you're already registered, there's nothing more you need to do to be eligible to earn. Some users, like @tldr, have already earned hundreds of dollars by simply registering their profile and setting their recast price. 

3) If you're not registered, you can do so by visiting the miniapp. This will give people you follow the ability to buy likes and recasts from you for a fee. 

4) Our priority with this rollout is to expand the number of buyers and help our registered signers earn more. 

5) However, with more buyers comes bad actors. We have implemented several anti-spam measures to maintain quality. We'll be actively monitoring this week to make sure posts meet our quality standards and reacting quickly if we see something we don't like.

text:
The issue is now patched - here‚Äôs a quick summary.

Check out Ben‚Äôs cast for the full write up.

cast.text:
Update on today's incident: We've identified a critical vulnerability in our withdrawal API, where there was an exploit that allowed unauthorized withdrawals to bypass our security checks. We've frozen withdrawing funds on smart wallets until this is fully resolved.

Most importantly - all smart contracts, admin wallets, and user smart wallets remain fully secure and uncompromised

The root cause was an authentication spoofing technique in our API routes due to architectural constraints within our auth system. We've learned a lot from this exploit and are implementing more robust security measures to prevent a situation like this from ever happening again.

All affected users will be refunded this week

text: lol thank you! now you and prof aren't the only match made at FC1

tons of users have been reaching out to me re: spam labels. when i look at their content, these are the 5 most common pieces of feedback i give:

1. don‚Äôt only post mini-apps. think of warpcast as early facebook: if someone only posted dolphin olympics screenshots every day, people would tune them out.

2. avoid overly generic content. casting "gm" or inspirational quotes is fine occasionally, but if your feed feels interchangeable with anyone else‚Äôs, it‚Äôs hard for people to connect with you.

3. don't use AI thoughtlessly. people notice when casts or replies feel like ChatGPT wrote them. it‚Äôs fine to use AI, just add real thoughts or emotions. authenticity wins here.

4. don‚Äôt repost stolen photos / art from the internet. farcaster values original content or curation that reflects your taste ‚Äî not just what‚Äôs trending on pinterest, reddit, or X.

5. quality > quantity. you don‚Äôt need to cast 10x a day or reply to everyone everywhere. take time to cast things you would stop scrolling to read.

Some loosely held beliefs on how money will flow to creators:  

- "sponsor" - get status, appreciation or access.
- "collect" - acquire aesthetic artifacts for status
- "invest" - get upside from being early 
- "buy" - get useful services

can't long post on here - so here's a screenshot

tl;dr

1. i believe in coining
2. i'm hopeful we'll see more experimentation
3. i'm sorry for my tweet this morning

will keep experimenting, making mistakes, taking the L (learnings) and figuring out how to do better. keep building, stay based

to be explicit: the north star for @base.base.eth is to grow the number of builders and creators onchain

creators and builders then generate the supply of use cases, content, etc that will onboard everyone else

everything we do is in this pursuit

I believe all of these things simultaneously:

1. Expanding the set of ways for people to earn online is good (and 
@zora is playing a role in this)

2. Earning on platforms like Zora is not an apples-to-apples comparison with Instagram payouts. It's an actively bad comparison when reasoning about second-order effects. The top of funnel source of funds is entirely different (businesses looking to convert customers on Insta vs. retail consumers on Zora)

3. The business model for tokenized content is still immature. It took attention platforms years of iteration to hone ads-based business models, and years more to start sharing with the people creating content. It'll likely take many iterations to figure out sustainable models for tokenized content (i.e. it can't just be retail speculating), but accelerating the timeline for sharing earnings with creators is good

I said something similar when @zora  launched their new model ‚Äî it doesn‚Äôt make sense unless it‚Äôs integrated into a much larger social graph/network. It‚Äôs obvious that‚Äôs coming (and soon duh). But until then they will be treated as memecoins and the ride will be bumpy. 

But I still own $lemons

cast.text:
Content coins will work if you get people to post them with sufficient quantity and frequency.

Until then, there will be a lot of push back. But the only way through is posting more.

Swap "being cool" with "established coin norms" and "being cringe" with "creating more coins".

text:
Remember how much most of Farcaster was worried about / scoffed at / looked down on / doubted early $degen?

(I do, bc I felt that way.)

And remember how quickly we changed our tune once $degen succeeded and got attention? And how it helped the network to a big growth moment?

^ This experience makes me much more humble about casting stones. 

Instead, I prefer to be open minded, give things a little time to play out, and ‚Äî most importantly ‚Äî do what I can to help out the builders who I believe in‚Ä¶ with whatever they happen to be trying!

text:
Content coins are net positive

But NFTs are often a better earnings mechanism for creators

Same podcast episode:

‚Ä¢ Zora: $430 volume ‚Üí $1.20 earned
‚Ä¢ Pods: $45 volume ‚Üí $25 earned

~10x less volume, ~20x more earnings

‚Ä¢ Coins = virality & upside
‚Ä¢ NFTs = sustainability & higher floor

It‚Äôs so early for onchain content - there's room for both models to win.

the truth is the effort to coin things from @base.base.eth went 0 to 1 in <1 day with @drewcoffman doing the creative and the only goal being use onchain tools
